Disk block write errors (Usually bad brokers)

panels.description: Top and bottom 3 brokers should have same number of partitions.
panels.title: Top & bottom 3 partition count /broker

panels.title: Top & bottom 3 Leader/Broker

panels.description: Number of leaders on this broker. This should be mostly even across all brokers.

panels.description: Number of partitions on this broker. This should be mostly even across all brokers.
panels.title: Partition Count per Broker

panels.description: Size of the request queue. A congested request queue will not be able to process incoming or outgoing requests
panels.title: Request Queue Size

panels.description: he average fraction of time the request handler threads are idle. Should always be above 30%.
panels.title: Request Handler Avg Idle Percent
Request Handler Avg Idle By Instance

panels.description: Fetch request rate for requests that failed.
panels.title: Failed Fetch Requests Rate

panels.title: Request Fetch Total Time

panels.description: Expired Delayed Produce in Purgatory, applies to the topics needs to be produced with acks=-1 (e.g. __consumer_offsets) topic
panels.title: Expired Delayed Produce (Offsets Commits)

panels.description: The request purgatory serves as a temporary holding pen for produce and fetch requests waiting to be satisfied. Keeping an eye on the size of purgatory is useful to determine the underlying causes of latency. Increases in consumer fetch times, for example, can be easily explained if there is a corresponding increase in the number of fetch requests in purgatory.
panels.title: Purgatory Fetch Sizes (top 5)

panels.description: The request purgatory serves as a temporary holding pen for produce and fetch requests waiting to be satisfied. Keeping an eye on the size of purgatory is useful to determine the underlying causes of latency. Increases in consumer fetch times, for example, can be easily explained if there is a corresponding increase in the number of fetch requests in purgatory.
panels.title: Purgatory Fetch Sizes

panels.description: Any disk write errors are shown here.
panels.title: Disk write errors (/mnt)

panels.description: The average fraction of time the network processors are idle. Should always be above 30%.
panels.title: Network Idleness

panels.description:
Indicates hitting max nebula throughput.

Incremented when sock_queue_rcv_skb reports that no memory is available; this happens if sk->sk_rmem_alloc is greater than or equal to sk->sk_rcvbuf.
panels.title: Udp_RcvbufErrors

panels.description: Number of replicas per partition. 2 replicas per partition is the sweet spot.
panels.title: Replica Count

panels.description: Number of in sync replicas. Less than 2 in sync replicas is a problem.
panels.title: In Sync Replica Count

panels.title: Under-replicated Partitions
